title: Roast Beef And Arugula Crostini With Olive-red Pepper Relish
summary: Roast Beef And Arugula Crostini With Olive-red Pepper Relish might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. This recipe makes 16 servings with 67 calories, 8g of protein, and 3g of fat each. For $1.01 per serving, this recipe covers 5% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 14 people have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have rare roast beef, slivered olives, thyme, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 2 minutes. This recipe is typical of Mediterranean cuisine. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 49%. This score is pretty good. Try Roast Beef and Arugula Crostini with Olive-Red Pepper Relish, Roast Beef Pumpernickel Sandwich with Roasted Red Pepper, Arugulan and Goat Cheese, and Steamed Wild Striped Bass with Yellow Pepper Romesco, Red Pepper-Black Olive Relish and Parsley-Garlic Oil for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are great choices for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Badian a Coltibuono Cultusboni RS Chianti Classico ( half-bottle). It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: Badia a Coltibuono Cultusboni RS Chianti Classico ( half-bottle)
productMatches.description: It is a fruity, soft and typical wine that is particularly food friendly.

instructions: Preparation                                        Mix red peppers, olives, thyme, and vinegar in small bowl for relish. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.) Reserve 2 tablespoons goat cheese for garnish. Spread remaining goat cheese on toasted baguette slices. Divide arugula among toasts. Fold roast beef slices to fit toasts; place atop arugula. Sprinkle beef slices lightly with salt and pepper. Top each with 1/3 teaspoon reserved goat cheese and small dollop of relish. Arrange crostini on platter and serve.

steps.step: Mix red peppers, olives, thyme, and vinegar in small bowl for relish. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.) Reserve 2 tablespoons goat cheese for garnish.
Spread remaining goat cheese on toasted baguette slices. Divide arugula among toasts. Fold roast beef slices to fit toasts; place atop arugula.
Sprinkle beef slices lightly with salt and pepper. Top each with 1/3 teaspoon reserved goat cheese and small dollop of relish. Arrange crostini on platter and serve.
